page.title: 14THE RAILWAY TODAY SWANAGE
page.content: In 1972 British Rail closed the line between Wareham and Swanage. Shortly afterwards Swanage Town Council started to demolish the track, the platform, the water-tower and the turnstile. The area became a scrap- yard and many private societies failed to get the railway back in working order, until now when a service is provided again. The original platform, canopy and water-tower have been completely restored. The track bed has been dug out, properly drained and a run-round loop has been laid. The ground control points, signalling and telephone systems are still being worked on. A completely restored turn table has come from the London Transport Museum which will replace the present hand driven one.
